author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1705774980}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273010303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1685917432}
review:
[h3] Enjoyable (4th game in the series) [/h3]

[b] Game Modes [/b]
Relaxed ~ No time constraints. No gold stars to collect.
Casual ~ Normal  mode, with gold stars.
Expert ~ More challenging, with gold stars.
[i]Can be selected anytime during the game.[/i]

[b] Bonus levels [/b]
Collect the hidden puzzle pieces to access a picture puzzle and additional bonus level for each of the 5 chapters.
 
[b] Achievements [/b] x22
Yet again there are 2 challenging achievements that require the player to get a higher score than the devs; for 1 and 10 levels. The required multiple replays quickly gets tedious.
Can't be bothered with these.

[b] Extras [/b]
Main menu option for 9 wallpapers.
In-game guide. Shows the hidden objects for each level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027047516', 'num_games_owned': 2313, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1665500066}
review:
This review is specially made for those who like to get all the achievements in games and have this one in their backlog (minor spoilers ahead).

[b]Description:[/b]  
12 Labors of Hercules IV is a casual puzzle/time management game with an ancient Greece theme where you have to collect resources around a map and then spend those resources constructing and repairing buildings and activating heroes to progress further in the map and fulfill the stage objectives. There are cutscenes that explain the main events of the story, but in this forth game of the series, the story has moved far beyond the classic mythology stories.

The game has an isometric view and the graphics look ok for a casual game. The characters and heroes like Hercules himself and Medusa have a cartoonish look but are easily recognizable.

The gameplay gets a bit repetitive since very few new mechanics are added. The only challenge you face is figuring out what to collect and build first and the best path to take, but most of the time clicking semi-randomly on stuff is enough to win, except when youâ€™re trying to beat the developer's score, to be able to do this you need a efficiency and a few tries to figure it out

But this fourth game changes some things when compared to the first one. There arenâ€™t any boss fights now, only puzzles you need to on the levels of each chapter, and later assemble to unlock a bonus level, and thereâ€™s also a new challenge: beating the developperâ€™s score, which will grant you a big star completion medal. One of the main changes is the appearance of an evil clone of Hercules that will block your workers and needs to be removed, and goat-like enemies that steal your resources. Also, there arenâ€™t any storage buildings but outposts where the workers can drop materials, and obelisks that add bonuses were also added and can now be constructed in some of the levels. 

[b]Achievements:[/b]  
[b]How many:[/b] 22 Achievements.
[b]How much time:[/b] Around 10 hours.
[b]Game difficulty:[/b] Very Easy. The levels can be passed with a gold rating quite easily if you play on casual, otherwise it will require a few tries until you figure out the optimal order to pick and build things.
[b]Achievementsâ€™ Difficulty:[/b] Easy. Compared to the first game the toughest challenge is beating the developer's scores, it requires a few tries but isnâ€™t hard to accomplish. My suggestion is trying to beat the score on the first 12 levels, the first seven will be the easiest, but the others require a few more tries. Keeping a queue of tasks prevents wasting time, but you still need to pick the right things to build in the right order, and sometimes also pick the best path.
 
[b]Overall opinion:[/b]  
12 Labors of Hercules IV is an okay casual game thatâ€™s easy to play, but gets repetitive fast, so my advice is playing it in small doses. This fourth game adds a few extra challenges that require a few tries but they are not very hard to complete.
 

[b]Join and follow my group [u][url=store.steampowered.com/curator/42556190-Ribbon-Hunters/] Ribbon Hunters[/url][/u] for more suggestions and reviews of easy indie games to get all the achievements.[/b]

El problema de este juego es la nula curva de dificultad que tiene y cÃ³mo completar el juego al completo no supone un reto (como mucho, el logro de superar 10 rÃ©cords del equipo de devs), descontando por supuesto el freeze habitual al arrancar el juego sin ningÃºn motivo aparente y con un equipo con potencia de sobras.

author: {'steamid': '76561199086098585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1657740056}
review:
[h3]12 Labours Of Hercules IV: Mother Nature[/h3]
[u]Zeitmanagement[/u]

Die Serie hat es mir irgendwie besonders angetan, auch wenn Optik und Spielprinzip sehr groÃŸe Ã„hnlichkeit mit einigen anderen Serien hat (z.B. Gnomes Garden u.a.). Da es aber immer wieder hÃ¼bsch aussieht und mir auch die Musik beim Spielen gefÃ¤llt, weiÃŸ ich ja, was mich erwartet.

Diesmal rÃ¤chten sich die GÃ¶tter wegen HerculesÂ´ letztem Sieg und lieÃŸen ein UngetÃ¼m das ganze Land verwÃ¼sten. Jetzt soll der leidgeprÃ¼fte Held mit seiner Gattin Megara alles wieder in Ordnung bringen, und dafÃ¼r haben sich die Entwickler wieder ein hÃ¼bsches Leveldesign ausgedacht.

Wie immer in dieser Spielereihe kann man sich aussuchen, ob man einfach nur zum entspannten Zeitvertreib spielt oder es darauf anlegt, die Level in "Goldzeit" zu schaffen, wofÃ¼r man am Ende mit einem kompletten Palastbau und Errungenschaften belohnt wird - Bonuslevel inclusive.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2792945616
Das Spiel nach der Uhr ist herausfordernd aber schaffbar. Diesmal gibt es auch eine besondere Herausforderung, nÃ¤mlich die Rekorde der Entwickler zu schlagen. Es ist also fÃ¼r jeden Anspruch ein Spielmodus vorhanden. 

Das Prinzip des Spiels sollte bekannt sein - es geht wieder darum, in jedem Level die vorgegebenen Ziele zu erreichen, wofÃ¼r Du HerculesÂ´ emsige Helfer los schickst, um Wege freizurÃ¤umen und Ressourcen zu sammeln bzw. zu produzieren. Das kann beim Spiel auf Zeit schon mal schief gehen, wenn man keine PrioritÃ¤ten setzt und es kann auch oft schon mal richtig knapp werden, noch in der genannten Goldzeit zum Ende des Levels zu kommen.

Die 100% Errungenschaften sind diesmal ein wenig schwieriger als sonst, es hat aber fÃ¼r viele (und auch fÃ¼r mich) einen gewissen Reiz, alle zu erringen, daher geht da schon mal ein wenig mehr Zeit drauf als beim einfachen Durchspielen ohne die Uhr - nach 14 Stunden Spielzeit war es dieses Mal geschafft.

Ein fehlerfreier weiterer Teil der Hercules Reihe, den ich jedem, der das Genre mag, ans Herz legen kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151163731', 'num_games_owned': 1632, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1640918112}
review:
This game is the exact same as the Alicia Quatermain series, except with Hercules, Megara, Midas and their "peers". I found this game to be slightly better looking overall and with better soundtracks than the Alicia Quatermain games. I have not played 12 Labours of Hercules I, II nor III, so I can't compare to those. After playing the game for a while (trying to get the achievements for instance), you might injure your hand/fingers. This is a game where you click a lot. 

This is not the best game for completionists in that some of the achievements need some higher skills than a regular players. I managed to get them all, but it took me a while. You'll need to switch the difficulty level to hard to get better score than the developers. Better do that one in the lower maps. Don't pick a bonus map for achievements, except the gold-time-in-bonus-maps achievements of course.

Recommended to players who like to click a lot, and timed puzzles of sorts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030788488', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1637548206}
review:
[h1]12 Labours of Hercules IV: Mother Nature[/h1] ...is a time-based resource management puzzle. Returning from vacation, Hercules and Megara find that the land devastated by drought, and must restore it while facing Hercules' doppelganger.

[h1]âš™ [u]Game Description & Mechanics[/u] âš™[/h1]
Your goal is to gather food, wood and gold to open paths, fix bridges and overpass several obstacles to achieve specific goals. You can pick up resources on the map, on various spawn points, from cleared obstacles or by exchanging it for other resources from various allies. Each level will also have a hidden puzzle piece, unlocking bonus levels.

Score is awarded based on how much time you have left when you successfully complete the level. Therefore, the challenge is in clearing the various obstacles in the correct order, with quick thinking and quick clicking. Wasting resources at the wrong place means you'll waste time waiting on resource spawning to proceed further.

Part of the strategy relies on investing resources on the right improvement, at the right time. Improve farms for more food, workshops for more wood, mines for more gold and your home for more servants. Improving them, of course, costs resources, so choosing which one to improve and when will affect your progress. You also get access to various abilities (different for each level) to boost worker speed, gather more resources or stop time.

[h1]â˜º [u]What I enjoyed[/u] â˜º[/h1]
While the fourth iteration of the game, I found the level design more challenging, and this is a good thing, because the whole point of the game is to get a 3-star rating everywhere. Most of the replayability will come from playing the same level multiple time to improve your score, with every second you save getting you closer to your goal.

There's a nice variety of obstacles to remove with different requirements, accumulated from past games, Sure, your servants remain the main tool to remove obstacles, with the occasional involvement of Hercules or Megara, but many others introduced in past games make a return: you'll need Cerberus against ghosts, Medusa against minotaurs, etc. New allies are also introduced to gather resources: Midas trades gold for other resources, Charon picks up driftwood, etc. The variety actually increases the challenge!

[h1]â˜¹ [u]What bothered me[/u] â˜¹[/h1]
If you aren't trying get perfect scores, you won't enjoy this game, even as a casual player. It is impossible to fail a level: on-the-map resources are calculated to make sure you can reach the resource spawn points, so there's no way to misspend your resource to a point you'll be stuck. And no matter how long you wait on resource spawning, there is no base time limit for level completion.

Storytelling has never been the focal point of the series, but it feels like they didn't even try with this one. Besides a short cutscene every 10 levels, most of the levels themselves don't really tell a story, at least not as much as the previous games did. You might go through all 10 levels with no actual progression, and with no effect on gameplay. For instance: [spoiler]When Hercules and Megara are separated, the game simply substitute saplings for stoned saplings, and boulders for titan's teeth,[/spoiler] which cancels any gameplay change this could've introduced.

[h1][b]My Verdict[/b]: â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†â˜† - [i]"It's up to you."[/i][/h1]

Sure, it's the same basic gameplay, graphics and soundtrack as the previous game, but that's exactly what's wanted by the target audience. This is not so much a sequel as it is a standalone extra level pack for those that enjoyed the previous iterations. If you've never played them, start with the first [I][url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/342580]12 Labours of Hercules[/url][/I] and work your way to this one if you like the genre.

[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198033910034', 'num_games_owned': 3900, 'num_reviews': 555, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1614410345}
review:
Highly recommended for casual time management fans.

Another great installment in the 12 Labours of Hercules series. If you are new to these games, then you might want to start with the first one, but it doesn't really matter. This continues to expand on what makes the previous games a lot of fun. This time there are some additional bonus levels that you unlock from collecting the puzzle pieces and then putting together a simple jigsaw puzzle. The story was a bit lacking this time around and sometimes it would hang up briefly when starting the game, but other than that, you are getting a great value for the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987468538', 'num_games_owned': 1409, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 349481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299179, 'last_played': 1705240071}
review: The legendary hero Hercules and his wife Megara are back, ready to embark on their next adventure! The Gods are outraged at their defeat and have summoned a fearsome beast who can match Hercules's god-like strength. The beast has trampled the countryside, turning lush gardens into desert wastelands! Restore the world's beauty by using everything at your disposal, from Megara's magical abilities to even a fire hydrant! Team up with friendly allies like King Midas and Epeius with his famous Trojan Horse to save Mother Nature from destruction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048842929', 'num_games_owned': 2402, 'num_reviews': 463, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1608729587}
review:
[h1]Review verfasst am 23.12.2020[/h1]

Auch der vierte Teil weiÃŸ zu Ã¼berzeugen, sofern man die VorgÃ¤nger und das Spielprinzip mag. Es gibt eine neue Story, mehr als 50 Levels, da es noch die Bonuslevels gibt und einen passenden, abwechslungsreichen Soundtrack. Die Grafik ist auch gefÃ¼hlt schÃ¶ner als bei den VorgÃ¤ngern. Bei diesem Teil ist es auch etwas leichter eine Goldwertung zu bekommen. AuÃŸerdem gibt es neben den Errungenschaften auch noch Sammelkarten. Das Game ist Zeitlos, es machte 2015 genauso viel SpaÃŸ, wie heute. Nach ca. 8 Stunden habe ich das Spiel beendet, hatte meinen SpaÃŸ und kann auch den 4 Teil der Serie wÃ¤rmstens weiterempfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074085825', 'num_games_owned': 4493, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 2491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2491, 'last_played': 1594603090}
review:
This is a must. I have all its predecessors, and think the designer's hit the mark with this sequel.
It has 3 options of difficulty. There are new "secret" challenges in some of the levels. The hidden puzzle pieces are back. The story is worth watching each stage's intro.
I have not quite figured out what about this version makes it a Collector's Edition other than the wallpapers, but I have not finished the game.
If you are a Time Management fan, this and the rest of the series are well worth the credits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198824302304', 'num_games_owned': 886, 'num_reviews': 552, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1606305232}
review: more of the same, but the story is boring and bad and at some point there are suddenly modern things in the game which are supposed to be jokes, but just not that funny. Like a submarina which is basically good for nothing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068369219', 'num_games_owned': 3316, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1458493616}
review: This series of games is probably the best and most representative for this whole genre of time management games. It has a light story, that sometimes is funny. It has lovable characters that develop from game to game.  It also has nice, easy to master mechanics and on top of it the graphics are nice enough not to be bothersome. The fact that it has challenges just adds to the replayability value. I highly recommend it and any of the game in these series.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977536331', 'num_games_owned': 2816, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 1040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1040, 'last_played': 1468251737}
review:
STORIA: Simpatica, un'altra allegra avventura con Ercole e i suoi compari.
GAMEPLAY: Casual, strategico, azione con raccolta di risorse.
GRAFICA: Bella, molto dettagliata in stile cartoon con degli ottimi intermezzi.
SONORO: Belle le musiche di accompagnamento mai noiose.
CONTROLLER: Consigliato mouse e tastiera.
DURATA: Circa 10 ore per il completamento di tutti gli achievement, dipende anche molto da quante volte dovete ripetere i livelli per raggiungere le fatidiche 3 stelle.
RUN COMPLETAMENTO: Una, si tratta alla fine solo di rigiocare i livelli per completare quello che si Ã¨ lasciato indietro.
COMMENTO: Pur essendo un casual game gli sviluppatori hanno prestato particolare attenzione ai dettagli e reso ogni livello unico pur mantenendo le stesse meccaniche di gioco. Livello di sfida sempre adeguato e lungo il giusto per non stancare. Consigliato per quei momenti dove si hanno solo 10 minuti - mezz'ora ma si vuole giocare comunque a qualcosa di stimolante e divertente. 
Se vi Ã¨ piaciuto il primo troverete appagante anche questo, se di contro siete stufi o non volete un altro "more of the same" allora cercate altro.
Il voto Ã¨ leggeremente piÃ¹ basso ma solamente perchÃ¨ non ci sono state novitÃ  di sorta in questo capitolo.
VOTO: 80/100

review: I like this installment because of its graphical side, the nature aspect is a nice touch for the game which is otherwise basically the same as the previous ones (as always). On the other hand, it has the most annoying game features so far - evil Hercules and constant hints which end like in a half of the game when you are quite sure what to do and when and do not want an intrusive guide.

12 Laboratories of Hercules IV: Mother Nature (Platinum Edition)
4/9 casual game from 2015

The legendary Hercules is back. Together with his beloved wife Megara, our hero embarks on his next adventure! The gods resent their defeat and create a fearsome creature that can compete with Hercules of godlike strength. The beast has devastated the whole country and turned the blooming gardens into dry wastes. Restore the old splendor with everything you have available - be it Megara's magical abilities or just a simple hydrant. Team up with Epeius and his Trojan horse or the friendly King Midas to save nature from destruction. So much for the content.
The fourth part is the best so far in my opinion.
Has a very balanced level of difficulty and the fun factor is higher than the others.
Therefore, my special recommendation for you for this series.

Here you will find my group and my archive with almost 1,000 reviews at the moment. Enjoy browsing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260331341', 'num_games_owned': 937, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1553836632}
review:
3/10 (long story short) It's an easy achievement clunky casual game with no mythology.

12 Labours of Hercules IV: Mother Nature (Platinum Edition) is nothing special and isn't as grand as the title might lead some to believe. I played about 10 hours and got all 22 achievements and at times it was hard for me to bring myself to continue playing because it was pretty boring. It has minimal mythology and, from what I've seen, is a copy paste of the previous titles. Granted I haven't played the previous ones. Hard to invest in and has little replay value. My takeaway:

[u]Pros[/u]
[list]
    [*]Good Message
    [*]Fun Quick Casual Gameplay
    [*]Easy 100%
    [*]Does Require (Some) Strategy
[/list]

[u]Cons[/u]
[list]
    [*]Fire Hydrants In Ancient Rome
    [*]Little Story
    [*]Little Soundtrack
    [*]Downright Annoying Sounds
    [*]Time Consuming
    [*]Just Like Every Other Title
    [*]Not Challenging
    [*]Cringy Script
    [*]Just A Bad Paid Game
[/list]

[spoiler]To win just point and click click click click click click click click click[/spoiler]

review: This was definitely better than the previous game as it has far more levels and they're more imaginative too. My only criticism would be that there are a number of levels where the time is so tight you have to look at the instructions to do it the perfect way and I think that ruins the joy of experimenting to see what works - if there's only one solution then it's a bit restrictive in gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198356141989', 'num_games_owned': 2521, 'num_reviews': 637, 'playtime_forever': 4487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4234, 'last_played': 1597776376}
review:
Back with Hercules after the third chapter dedicated to women, this game follows exactly the same footsteps set down by 12 Labours of Hercules II and III.
The first chapter had some minor differences (mainly the auto-recharging resources with time: food, wood and gold - here, and in the previous chapters, you have to constantly collect them), but this one is really the same of the previous ones.
And it's awesome.
It's essentially a point and click game: you'll have dozens of levels in which there will be some tasks to complete - build something, clear the paths, destroy some enemies and such.
In order to do so, the whole map will always be filled with things to collect, buildings to create and to upgrade, enemies to defeat, thieves and so on..
This game keeps the relax mode along with the normal and hard ones, it has an awesome timer system and it poses a real challenge - you'll have for each single map to value each single movement to do, since concentrating only on one side of the task will maybe put you in a total shortage of wood or gold, leading to seconds in which you won't be able to do anything.
It's a great game like the whole series - if you like point and click adventures, this one's for you too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184897393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 653, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1562353701}
review:
The fourth entry in this time-management series. It does add a few new gameplay elements this time around, but it still gets tedious - especially with a 5th section (56 scenes total, plus 5 jigsaw-like "puzzles").  Designed for (and probably easier to play on) a touchscreen, I can only recommend this if you really like this genre with a keyboard and mouse.

review:
Fourth of the titular Greek Mythos time management series, [b]12 Labours IV[/b] returns with everything the previous installment did, save for some cosmetic variations on the same core mechanics. Fans of the genre will enjoy more content, but some may grow weary of its increasingly cut and paste design.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Beautiful artwork
+ More variety of background music
+ Difficulty selection, developer score challenge
+ Jigsaw Puzzle collectibles which unlock an additional 6 stages
+ Multiple routes for strategic planning and good AI pathing
+ Stuck? Check guides for each level to show you intended solutions and hidden objects
+ Good length for its low price; 56 stages

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Unlike the original, no minigames to be found besides the Jigsaws. Boss stages haven't returned.
- Repeated copyright free music that has appeared in every game so far
- The story is even more nonsensical than the last; feels forced for the sake of making another game.
- Silly anachronisms like fire hydrants & submarines in ancient Greece?

[i]Herc IV[/i] is a well made casual game, make no mistake. But I found myself rushing to complete it as i became overwhelmed by deja vu from prior installments. The only actual addition to this episode was hidden objects, yet their score-centric purpose makes them easily skippable and only account for a few stages in total. I really miss the minigames from the original that accentuated the world segments... maybe bosses will return someday? One can only hope.

[u]Achievement Hunters[/u]: Simple to 100%, with two potential hangups. First, developer times require the highest difficulty and leave little room for error. Luckily there are level guides to show you the sequence, and with practice you can cut corners to shave seconds and come out ahead. Don't forget the nowhere-explained bonus points from clicking flying birds, that just might put you over the edge for the win. Earlier stages are some of the easiest.

Second, anti-theft is best tackled in 2.8, with the caveat that you don't build out unnecessary resource generators that thieves would be able to reach. Ignore half the stage and slowly build the exit bridge. You'll go way over the gold time limit but you'll complete the challenge.

Happy hunting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329283449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1558711299}
review:
For those completionists like me, getting that "beat 10 developer records" achievement is much easier than I found it to be in the third game of the series. I played on expert until I got the achievement and only really needed to go through the 1st and part of the 2nd chapters by putting in minimal effort. I'm certain someone actually trying hard could probably knock it out earlier and then could get through the rest of it on casual easily. 

That difference is what makes this version far more enjoyable to go through in comparison to the slog it felt like the third could be at times. Very good if you have a game you just want to knock out super quickly.

review:
Cuarta entrega de la saga, muy similar a las versiones anteriores, se presenta de manera time manager, es juego casual, adictivo y divertido.
Es un juego donde debes restaurar Ã¡rboles, jardines, caminos, entre otras cosas. Existen 3 modos de dificultad relajado, informal y experto, siendo este Ãºltimo un verdadero reto. Cada nivel se completa dentro del tiempo que es otorgado dando una puntuaciÃ³n de 1 a 3 estrellas y se ira revelando una parte del castillo.
Todos los niveles tienen piezas de rompecabezas, y los mismos son rejugable para mejorar la puntuaciÃ³n o para encontrar esas piezas que no pudiste hacer a la primera. 
Durante el juego tus obreros deberÃ¡n construir y mejorar las instalaciones para ir pasando los niveles y a medida que vamos avanzando iremos recibiendo bonificaciones que se pueden usar cada vez que el medidor se llene para hacer que los trabajadores sean mÃ¡s rÃ¡pidos y recolecten mÃ¡s recursos. 
Tiene 50 niveles, HÃ©roes Legendarios, y unas cuantas horas de juego.

Es una buena adquisiciÃ³n siempre y cuando sea de sale o bundle. En cuanto a grÃ¡ficos, sonidos, musicalizaciÃ³n, no tengo mucho para aportar, es Ã³ptimo a lo que ofrece el juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1552894983}
review:
Yet another 12 Labours of Hercules clicker game ported from tablet.   Click things randomly on the screen to progress through the levels.  No meaningful decisions or gameplay involved. 

This belongs on tablet and it should have stayed there.   $4.50 for something less than half the price on the app stores.  The only mystery is why there are so many cookie cutter sequels to this series.

More Herculean fun! Mostly more of the same, with a few new abilities for both Hercules and Megara. Also has five acts instead of four, so you get 25% more strategic goodness.

Runs great on Linux (Mint 18.2).

review:
[code][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33025671-Missi-the-Achievement-Huntress/] Please see my curator page for more games that are worth your time [/url][/code]

Approximate amount of time to 100%: 14 hours
Estimated achievement difficulty: 5/10
Minimum number of playthroughs needed: 1, level selection
Has it been in a bundle: Yes
Is there a good guide available: Yes for the overlord achievement you can find a guide [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=837527201] here [/url]
How many people have complete this game at the time I'm writing this review: 747 on Astats

Multiplayer achievements: No
Missable achievements: No, level selection
Grinding Achievements: Yes, getting the gold reward on every level
DLC-Only achievements: No
Time-gated achievements: No
RNG-achievements: No
Does difficulty affect achievements: Yes, on easy you aren't able to beat the developer's record.
Unobtainable/glitched achievements: No

This is the best "time-management" game series I know. Loved it a lot and completed Game 1 to 5 in a very short time. Looking forward to part 6 and 7.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059334622', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 2459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1686208095}
review: Pretty much the same concept as the 3rd game but now with the addition of in game guides which you can check step-by-step while doing each level. God bless. Unfortunately though, still couldn't beat all the dev scores mainly the last one cause the devs 100000% cheated so whatever lol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101204245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 10513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6795, 'last_played': 1585981838}
review: Every iteration of this game raises the difficulty level, so the game grows with you to keep challenging you as you play through the series.  It's a pretty remarkable achievement in casual gaming, I think.  This game gets a level of care that you don't expect in simple clicker games.  Can't recommend the whole series enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982920009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1490011496}
review:
Same review for all the games in this series as they are all 95% the same.

Very basic, the the point where you think its target audience are children. Enjoyable at first, gets awefully reptitive if you play through all four games which I have. Very simple point and click timer challenge game that isn't a challenge, from what I remember they throw skills at you pretty early one like "double servent speed" which on some maps is crazy OP. The story is linear, sounds again like something out of a book you'd find in the childrens corner of a library. Colourful and interative..... 

Ok thats it, this mustve been made for kids, if you ain't a kid or of a simple mind like myself then you'll regret buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1528019800}
review: This fourth time the 12 Labours of Hercules series on Steam presents us with a Platinum Edition, which includes more levels (thereâ€™s now 56 in total) and a neat strategy guide in-game. Thereâ€™s also a few additions to the gameplay, without changing the formula. Itâ€™s still basically a copy-paste of the previous games, but this time the game manages to be a sequel with more and revamped content. I like these games, theyâ€™re easy to play, hard to master, and have colorful art. Although this is just more of the same, itâ€™s more of the same good stuff. If you enjoyed the other titles, you wonâ€™t be disappointed with this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977197768', 'num_games_owned': 3607, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1527939600}
review:
Mother Nature est le quatriÃ¨me volet de la sÃ©rie des "12 labours of Hercules", comme pour les prÃ©cÃ©dents il est composÃ© de 4 lieux qui comportent 10 niveaux chacun et si on ajoute un niveau bonus par lieu cela donne 44 niveaux.

Effectivement, beaucoup de personnes trouvent qu' entre le 1 et le 4, il n'y a pas beaucoup de changement de gameplay. Pour autant, personnellement, je retrouve toujours les nouvelles aventures de MÃ©gara et Hercules avec plaisir et cette sÃ©rie reste Ã  mon avis l'une des meilleures que ce soit en terme de "management des ressources" ou des graphismes. 

Et d'ailleurs, j'achÃ¨te ce genre de jeu non pas parce qu'il change en permanence de jouabilitÃ© mais bien au contraire parce que je sais que je n'aurais pas de souci sur la faÃ§on de jouer ni que cela me prendra 3 heures pour faire un niveau.

C'est simple, pas compliquÃ© Ã  jouer et on peux facilement trouver un peu de temps pour faire un niveau ou deux par jour.... Alors inutile de bouder son plaisir.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980796094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1491331274}
review:
I enjoyed this whole series of games and finished all of them. It's usually a challenging experience to get all the extra achievements and it can get really hectic for some three star ratings. Time management games need a lot of charm to be compelling enough. This one does, giving us a goofey greek mythology based story and some mythological allies. You need to like this particular genre to like anything about the game, but if you do, you're not going wrong with the Labors of Hercules.

This is the fourth installment with minor changes of mechanics, but at the core, it is the same game.

Follow my curator at https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28337205-Fair-Minded-Witness/

review: Hercules IV. Basically, it's just a carbon copy of the other 3 games, it's enjoyable, but not really much more to say about the series. author: {'steamid': '76561198035094289', 'num_games_owned': 4896, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1453354237}
review:
The 12 Labours of Hercules games are all "time management" games, but for those who hate feeling pressured by time, you can just enjoy the game and ignore the clock. You won't get "gold time," but the game will let you play each board to completion. You can come back later and go for the gold if you want.
These games are colorful, and just fun; nothing too challenging really, and the story isn't going to have you biting your nails in anticipation or dread. It's just fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083754515', 'num_games_owned': 6676, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2455, 'last_played': 1453250386}
review:
[h1][u]The following review applies to all games from the "12 Labours of Hercules" series.[/u] Even though they have different themes, they all have the same gameplay style and overall quality.[/h1]

[b]The "12 Labours of Hercules" series has extremely captivating resource-management games, with beautiful and enjoyable graphics, sound effects and soundtrack.[/b] Even though they are casual games, they offer some challenge if played in difficult mode. [b]The achievements are relatively easy to get[/b] - by the time you finish the game, you'll probably have gotten them all, or at least have just a couple to complete.

An interesting factor is that [b]with each new title in the series the developers seem to add and improve game mechanics.[/b] Although they have a "background storyâ€, the narrative is very simple and each title has its own theme, so [b]there is no need to play them in any specific order.[/b]

[b]The cost benefit of the games is very good, since in addition to all having cards, they are also pretty cheap.[/b] So far there are 7 games in the series, costing $ 2.99 each or $ 16.73 for the complete pack. Since most of them have been in several bundles and frequent sales, it is quite easy to get them for less than "full price".

[i]*Personally, I recommend buying the complete pack during the big sales (Summer Sale and Winter Sale, around June and December), and you donâ€™t even need to pay the full price if you already have some of the games.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198120530775', 'num_games_owned': 3399, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1520644579}
review:
Nice game. Is very relaxed and funny. There's some strategy involved. Is just like the previous Hercules games with a few novelties. Finished it in about 12 hours, but you can do it in a lot less or a lot more if you change the difficulty or if you're not trying for the achivements.

No bugs found. Works fine on win 7.

Is usually very cheap and it has cards and easy to get achivements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097473222', 'num_games_owned': 2756, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 1855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1855, 'last_played': 1508600058}
review:
I will Rate based on :
Story 8/10: There was not much of a story, but what little there was, I did like it
Combat: 2/10: There wasnt much of any combat present
Characters:6/10: Few characters, but they did what they were supposed to 
Multiplayer: Non Existent
World 8/10: The World Design itself was better then expected
Visual 8/10 : It had cute graphics
Sound 8/10 : The Sound was pleasant to listen to
Bugs: I did not find any 
Rage: I did not feel any, and that is great
Price: is Definetly worth it

I rate it a minimum of 7,5/10, it gave me almost 40 hours of fun, definetly worth it

review:
[h1]ğŸ® [u]12 Labours of Hercules IV: Mother Nature[/u] ğŸ®[/h1]

Vierter Teil der [url=http://store.steampowered.com/bundle/5893/12_Labours_of_Hercules_7in1_Bundle/]Sieben[/url] aus dem Hause von [url=http://store.steampowered.com/search/?developer=Jetdogs%20Studios]Jetdogs Studio[/url] und [url=http://store.steampowered.com/search/?developer=Zoom%20Out%20Games]Zoom Out Games[/url]. Alles beim Alten mÃ¶chte ich vorweg schicken. Naja nicht ganz!

[b]VerÃ¤nderungen bzw. Neuerungen[/b]

Es bleibt bei den 40 Leveln plus den fÃ¼nf Bonusleveln. Dieses Mal bahnt man sich seinen Weg als Herkules und Megara. Dabei sind die Tooltipps dieses Mal sogar hilfreich, wobei man sie als geÃ¼bter Spieler der Reihe nicht mehr benÃ¶tigt. Mit Portalen und neuen Items hat man auch kleine VerÃ¤nderungen an der Mechanik hinzugefÃ¼gt, wobei das wesentliche Element eigentlich das ist, dass man Rohstoffe nicht mehr farmt sondern quasi erzeugt. Daher auch der Name "Mother Nature". Zwar ist das Bezwingen der Entwicklerrekorde in seiner Schwierigkeit gesenkt worden und die Schwierigkeit scheint insgesamt gesunken zu sein, in Anbetracht dessen dass man das Gold-Level jedoch nur noch im fortgeschrittenen Modus oder hÃ¶her erreicht, allerdings eine zu verschmerzende Ã„nderung. Die versteckten Puzzleteile sind auch wieder schwieriger zu finden und fÃ¼r eine Errungenschaften behilft man sich am besten per [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1274983040]Guide[/url]. Grafisch gab es keine VerÃ¤nderungen, musikalisch eine kleine Repertoierweiterung was die Trackanzahl anbelangt. 

[b]Fazit[/b]

Es ist weiterhin ein gutes Timemanagement-Gelegenheitsspiel und man hat, im Vergleich zum direkten VorgÃ¤nger, wieder zu alter Form gefunden. Das ist erfreulich!  Das Spiel eignet sich nach wie vor fÃ¼r kleinere Kinder unter 8 Jahren. Mit 95% Rabatt konnte man das Spiel schon fÃ¼r 0,14â‚¬ bei Steam erwerben, da macht man nichts falsch. Es ist aber auch seine 2,99â‚¬ wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044918687', 'num_games_owned': 1743, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1516406146}
review:
Did you play the first three? Did you like the first three? Do you like reasonably easy achievments and cards? 
If you answered yes to any of these questions I would probably recommend it to you, as long as you're ok with more of the same.

Honestly, I'm not sure what else to say. How do you write a review for almost the same game six times?

author: {'steamid': '76561198041922797', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1514672522}
review:
A must have if on sale, an OK addition if you can buy it at regular.

One of these games that you sit down and you just want to finish - easy, simple, intuitive. Great if you want to talk a bit more about the Greek Mythology with kids.

review: Estos juegos son todos un pasatiempo increible, los he adquirido todos (en descuento) y debo decir que cumplen con lo que se proponen, juegos de gestion de tiempo, cuyo objetivo es entretener y pasar un tiempo sin mucho estres. El argumento es de locos, pero es lo de menos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245837576', 'num_games_owned': 1825, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1502490005}
review:
TL;DR - Buy it if you like the series. Get extra new levels, and play with your favorite Greek god Hercules. 6/10

12 Labours of Hercules IV: Mother Nature is the fourth game in the franchise. The game is not much of a difference from its predecessors. The gameplay remains similar to those in most of the builder games out there; this involves building and upgrading facilities, fixing roads, getting resources and at times, summoning the "useful" Hercules to clear the heavy boulders and Megara to grow trees on deserted lands. In Mother Nature, queuing workerâ€™s tasks are easier than ever â€“ there are numbered flags that indicate the order in which the tasks will be completed.

Special power-ups also are back. They are really useful, especially as the levels get more complicated. Moreover, there are hidden puzzle pieces to collect in each level â€“ every 10 levels, they can be put together to form a mosaic picture. Get that 100% while you can.

On the presentation side, 12 Labours of Hercules IV offers an ok experience, although nothing spectacular. The artwork is cartoonish with bright colors and a simple visual style; still, the animations are surprisingly nice and smooth.

The soundtrack, playing from game to game in the series, gets repetitive. It's sort of new for every game, but it just gets too repetitive and not memorable.

There are three difficulty settings available to select in Mother Nature; Relaxed, Casual and Expert. No matter which mode you decide to play on, 12 Labours of Hercules IV is a very challenging game. The difficulty of the game progresses nicely from the first level to the last, the latter levels really require some careful strategic planning as well as management skills.

Overall, this game is just like the others. The Collectorâ€™s Edition is not exactly heavy on the extras. It featured 10 bonus levels, a strategy guide, wallpapers, achievements and collectibles. Still, you get it when you purchase the game. Enjoy it, and hopefully you won't get too bored of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008038210', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1490479331}
review:
It's a Time based Management game with the story about Hercules and wife Megara. They are going on a new adventure where the gods are outrage because of the previous games story outcome. And Summoned a Fearsome beast that matches Hercules's strength.

I can highly recommend this game for some nice casual puzzling and relaxing.
Nice to play for a quick game but easily to get sucked into playing more!
Each Chapter has 10missions and each Chapter starts with a Voiced cinematic intro.
Every mission will have 1puzzle piece to find. With all pieces found in a chapter the bonus level will unlock.
You can easily get all achievements aswell within 13 hours. 

Pro's:
- Great Time Management game
- Hercules theme
- Voiced Cinematics
- Great Audio
- Puzzle pieces unlocking bonus level


Cons:
- No bossfights/minigames

Great price aswell i really loved them up to 5 and including 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125771599', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1452709012}
review: I played all four of the current games in literally 3 days because I was so bored (stuck at families house for two months). Each of them made me smile in my time of complete and utter boredom. I wouldn't have found them if my familie's internet wasn't terrible and I couldn't play anything else really (took 2 hrs to download even these games). I'm glad I did find and play them though I love greek and roman mythology, although these are very loosely based. They're cute and fun and rewarding. So if you find yourself bored or need a simple game to detox a nasty rage quit play these they'll soothe the sadness and rage away for a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045655704', 'num_games_owned': 3553, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1489840599}
review:

Dans cet opus, les Dieux veulent se venger de tout ce que Hercules leur a fait subir et l'empoisonnent. Il lui faut un an pour s'en remettre, et une fois sur pied, il constate que son royaume a Ã©tÃ© dÃ©sertÃ©. Tout est assÃ©chÃ©. Avec l'aide de sa femme Megara, il va devoir redonner Ã  la nature sa beautÃ© perdue. Mais pour lui mettre des bÃ¢tons dans les roues, les Dieux font sortir un Hercules malÃ©fique d'un miroir magique.
MÃªmes mÃ©caniques donc, le mÃªme gameplay Ã©galement. On a tout de mÃªme droit Ã  deux ou trois nouveautÃ©s bienvenues, comme l'arrivÃ©e des portails dans certains niveaux.
Encore une fois, le 100% succÃ¨s est ralenti par les temps des dÃ©veloppeurs Ã  battre, comme dans les deuxiÃ¨me et troisiÃ¨me jeux.
[i]12 Labours of Hercules IV: Mother Nature[/i] fait souvent l'objet de rÃ©ductions attractives en offre de la semaine, il est intÃ©ressant de le prendre Ã  ce moment-lÃ .

author: {'steamid': '76561198119019501', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1489366446}
review: A great little time management game and the fourth in the series adds more levels and more to the simple story. Each of the games in this series are offering longer playtime and more challenging levels. All of the levels feel very different and thought out. The challenges/achievements can be difficult, but obtainable. All of these games go on sale often, so you can catch an even better deal for their worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047540387', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1709988572}
review:
I've played all of the ones before this, and as usual it's a great little game.

The game itself is easy to pick up and doesn't require much skill, as it's just point and click. It's incredibly charming, with cute graphics and fun little cutscenes.

Honestly, for Â£1.99 you can't go wrong. I usually get around 6-10 hours of playtime out of these games, and this one came in at about 9 hours. Thats good value imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016525054', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1488299706}
review:
Oh no, no, this is not how it works. The Hercules 1 was a good game, but this one I would NOT recommend and this is why:
1) It's too simple. Although I set a medium difficulty, it's still weird I was getting gold medals only.
2) What's worse, the game is loosing any sense starting from chapter 3 as you don't need to plan your path anymore. All you need to do is just click, click, click .... click and click as f***king rapid as you can on all farms you have in order to send your minions to grab resources. Just make 500 stupid clicks ... profit! 
Don't waste your time on this game, take the 1st part, not this one ;)

review: Got Episodes 1 through 5 when on sale. Played the first one, completed it fully. Played the second one. Just get the trading cards and uninstalling. All of these should not be separate games. It should all be one game with the price of each game.

review:
Je repose mon Ã©valuation du premier opus puisque toute la sÃ©rie se vaut :
"La sÃ©rie des Jeux Hercules est sympa bien qu'assez rÃ©pÃ©titive Ã  la longue. On peut s'intÃ©resser Ã  ces jeux lorsque comme moi on est en train de faire autre chose et que l'on veut juste un petit jeu cool que l'on peut arrÃ©ter quand on veut . Cette sÃ©rie dispose d'un certain challenge quand on veut finir tous les succÃ¨s notamment les records de devellopeurs qui peuvent donner un peu de fil Ã  retordre.
En rÃ©sumÃ© j'ai passÃ© un moment agrÃ©able sur cette suite Ã  l'esthÃ©tique agrÃ©able mais il faut aimer ce genre de jeu de gestion. Il n'y aura pas de frissons, de combats Ã©piques ou encore de dÃ©fis grandioses .... Juste du click en folie :)"

author: {'steamid': '76561198074045320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3055, 'last_played': 1486171790}
review:
Big fan, played all episodes. Episode one still has the best mechanics, you get stuff while being idle there, later you always have to click for income.  
Game lacks a speed system, but is more fun for perfectionists and much more strategic with external tools running it on a lower speed.  

Negative rating is deserved through the latest patch, the game now forces a connection to an online server spamming the menu with an ad for some other game - some "free" pay to win sheet.
Thumbs down to the devs for this behaviour, I don't pay for a game to watch you fukn ads.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158769859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1484491024}
review:
[b]12 Labours of Hercules IV: Mother Nature[/b] is the fourth instalment in the [b]12 Labours of Hercules[/b]series. As I have already reviewed the earlier games and explained the core mechanics and changes in those reviews, I will skip those here save the summary that this game, like its predecessors, is a time management game where Megara, Hercules and their workers have to clear lanes, collect resources and construct buildings in order to progress through the levels.

This game changes very little compared to [b]12 Labours of Hercules III: Girl Power[/b]. The number of total levels is increased from 45 to 56, including the (super) secret levels. Some new music has been added and the story features a plot by the antagonists of the last three instalments.
The biggest change may very well be the guide button in the lower left corner of each level, where you can find the optimal way to complete the goals and find the puzzle pieces. Some levels also have items that you can click for extra points; the locations of these can also be found in the guide. Needless to say, the guide is optional.

I have always had my misgivings regarding the story and music in these games, but they do try to bring something new to the table this instalment. And I like the changes made, also with regards to the story and music. Therefore, another recommendation from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971047607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1480209697}
review:
Another strong installment in the 12 Labours franchise. IV Mother Nature doesn't add any major improvements or developments over the previous 3 games, but yet feels smoother and more polished.

If you like time and resource management games, then I can recommend this along with the previous games.
The only issue I had was some mouse acceleration problems (due to my alt-tabbing) but a restart fixed the problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988271944', 'num_games_owned': 1346, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1479863632}
review:
Quarto capitolo della serie 12 Labours of Hercules. Come al solito sarÃ² ripetitivo; ma questo gioco non delude mai.

Sempre lo stesso stile di gioco, la stessa metodologia che vi terrÃ  incollati allo schermo, livello dopo livello, fino a quando non lo completerete.

Gioco semplice, che richiede solo un minimo di pianificazione per perseguire i nostri obbiettivi e superare i livelli ma senza doversi sforzare troppo.

Consigliato a chi piace il genere e a chi non Ã¨ solito giocare questi tipi di giochi.

Il gioco spesso e volentieri Ã¨ scontatissimo qui su Steam e secondo il mio parere varrebbe giÃ  di per se il suo prezzo pieno.

In questo capitolo non ci sono state aggiunte di nessun tipo, Ã¨ tale e quale al precedente, tantomeno qualche traccia musicale in piÃ¹ visto che dopo un pÃ² di tempo sempre le stesse canzoni vengono a noia. 

Come ogni capitolo della serie, personalmente consiglio anche questo.

Voto 6,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1455384483}
review:
[h1] Vorwort [/h1]

Diese Serie macht SpaÃŸ und man kann gut seine Zeit damit vertreiben. Im Herzen, ist es aber das gleiche Spiel, unabhÃ¤ngig von Verbesserungen und neuen Funktionen. Aus diesem Grund kann es schnell langweilig werden. 12 Labours of Hercules IV bietet aber die gleiche, solide Erfahrung wie die vorherigen Spiele.  

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Das Gameplay hat sich zu den VorgÃ¤ngern nicht verÃ¤ndert. Man schickt seine Arbeiter/Helden zum Ressourcen einsammeln, diese werden dann benutzt, um GebÃ¤ude auszubauen oder Hindernisse zu beseiten. 

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ gute Spielzeit
+ UnterstÃ¼tzung verschiedener Betriebssysteme
+ Errungenschaften und Trading Cards
+ hat eine kleine Geschichte, hatten frÃ¼heren Spiele der Serie nicht
+ feundlicher gestaltet, wie die frÃ¼heren Teile
+ bietet neue Spielmechaniken, Features und BÃ¶sewichte
+ Megara und Hercules stehen mehr im Vordergrund und spielen eine aktive Rolle

[h1] Neutral [/h1]

- Im Grafikdesign hat sich zu den VorgÃ¤ngern wenig geÃ¤ndert, entweder man liebt sie oder eben nicht

[h1] Nachteile [/h1]

- die Level sind nicht sehr anspruchsvoll
- einige neue Inhalte, aber im Grunde das gleiche wie in frÃ¼heren Spielen

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

NeuankÃ¶mmlinge kÃ¶nnen bei 12 Labours of Hercules IV: Mother Nature bedenklos zugreifen, da dieses Spiel einen guten Einstieg bietet in dieses Genre. Fans der Serie sollten etwas warten, bis das Spiel reduziert ist, da man recht wenig neues geboten bekommt. Klare Kaufempfehlung fÃ¼r Casual Fans oder die es gerne werden mÃ¶chten.

review:
This time around Hercules battles climate change. 
Insane meteorological events have occured across the Pelleponensus - Sharknados, Crocodile Tsunamis, Moose Sandstorms.
Gaia is at it again, unleashing this madness upon the Ancient Greek world. 
Hercules must chub up and take on Mother Nature herself. 

Fourth time around and it's still fun. Nothing detracting from it. 
Good fun for all age gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118005728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 566, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1469343049}
review: 12 Labours of Hercules IV: Mother Nature is a casual resource/time management strategy game. This time around, Hercules and Megara are trying to restore the land. Hercules still does the heavy work if there's a boulder in the way and Megara still brings the fruit bushes to life and also restores life to the dead trees. At the start of each level, you have 1 or 2 workers who you direct to do various things ranging from collecting resourses to constructing and upgrading buildings or gold mines. You also have to contend with bandits trying to steal your resourses. There are the familiar characters of Medusa, Cerberus, Cyclops, and Pegasus who help get rid of the minotaurs, ghosts, rescue sheep and move rocks to aid in the journey. If you find all the puzzle pieces in levels .1-.10 you can put the puzzle together and unlock a bonus level. Nice forth entry of the series and overall it's a very enjoyable time management and if you're a fan of the genre you should pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028450654', 'num_games_owned': 5815, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1467744273}
review:
Ich liebe diese 12 Labours of Hercules Reihe einfach. Die ersten drei Teile habe ich auch schon weggesuchtet und ich weiÃŸ nicht einmal genau warum ich so einen riesen SpaÃŸ habe, bzw. doch eigentlich schon, ich versuche es mal zu erklÃ¤ren. 

Ich arbeite relativ viel, meistens 10-12 Stunden am Tag und habe in der Woche wenig Lust mich dann noch ausgiebig mit meinem Hobby, dem Spielen zu beschÃ¤ftigen, weil ich das als anstregnend empfinde mich dann noch wieder mehrere Stunden auf ein AAA Titel zu konzentrieren, kurz gesagt, mir ist Far Cry, Assassins Creed, Tomb Raider etc. dann einfach zu anstrengend. Es muss also etwas her, wo man einfach nur ein bisschen klicken kann, nur so minimal nachdenken muss und was auch noch irgendwie ganz nett ausschaut, 12 Labours of Hercules ist dafÃ¼r perfekt. 

12 Labours of Hercules IV: Mother Nature ist also genau das, was ich nach Feierabend brauche, wo ich munter eine Stunde rumklicken kann und trotzdem auf Achievementjagt gehen kann, wobei dieses Mal alle leicht machbar sind. Lediglich ein Level musste ich fÃ¼r die Goldzeit doppelt spielen, das ging beim ersten mal um eine Sekunde nicht auf. Ansonsten ist das Spiel wie man es aus der Reihe gewohnt ist, 50 Level, 5 Bonuslevel und ein Superbonuslevel, wieder Puzzleteile und eine minimalistische Story, wenn man das Ã¼berhaupt so nennen kann. 

In irgendeinem Teil gabs mal so Bosslevel, die habe ich hier ein wenig vermisst, die waren ganz cool, dennoch bekommt 12 Labours of Hercules IV: Mother Nature einen klaren Daumen nach oben, ein perfektes kurzweiliges Spiel fÃ¼r zwischendurch, viel SpaÃŸ beim Spielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1467554715}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Casual Puzzle game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

[b]Video Settings information.[/b]

[list]
    [*]You are able to play the game in fullscreen or windowed mode.
    [*]There is NO resolution size Available.
[/list]

[b]Volume Settings Information.[/b]

[list]
    [*]There is a Sound volume Slidebar available.
    [*]There is a Music Volume Slidebar available.
[/list]

[b]Miscellaneous Information.[/b]


[list]
    [*]You can toggle the game cursor into your cursor. Game cursor is slower!
[/list]

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

Hercules is one of the most laziest character in this game. His slaves has to do literally everything for him, such as collecting wood, food and gold resources. They are also able to build and upgrade structures or clear certain hinder. Hercules really likes to brag whenever he has lifted up a boulder.

The gameplay is practically the same on each level and you will have to beat a level within a time limit. The faster you are able to complete a level, the better your score will be upon completion. In some of the levels you are able to use a buff and you will be able to see a buff meter on the side of the screen. You can't choose which buff you wishes to have with you on a trip and the buff won't last for a super long time if you have activated during a level.


[b]Ingame Information.[/b]

[list]
    [*]Gameplay is pretty much the same all the time.
    [*]The graphics and the soundtrack are okay.
    [*]The story is okay.
    [*]The game is very simple and easy to understand.
    [*]The game is very calm.
[/list]


[b]Miscellaneous Information.[/b]


[list]
    [*]You are able to achieve medals and beating it under the timer may grant you a gold medal.
[/list]

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

There are different series of this game out there but the gameplay is pretty much the same. There are some little changes here and there but it's not a huge game changer. Therefore i will copy and paste this review over to other series.

-------------------


[quote] Reviews are always uploaded if i have at least played for 2 hours or more. Unless the game is really garbage and doesn't deserve the 2H limit.[/quote]

I Give this game a 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198059934690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1467195180}
review:
It's... OK. To be honest, I just enjoyed the one Wild West-themed tune on a few of the levels. 

Other than that, it's the same gameplay as the rest of the series, with the same mechanics, same music, etc. No wonder they can come out with a new game every few months; they're almost carbon copies. 

Oh yeah, the writing/plot is still hilariously rubbish with no hint of actual mythology apart from a few references. At least there is none of the 'trying to rhyme' now so it's just garbage prose and can be written off as such.

5/10, got my 50 cents worth but that's about all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998281238', 'num_games_owned': 4729, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1542823356}
review:
Boy, I sure do love doing the same thing over and over for every one of the 60+ levels.  Not only that, it's the same exact thing you had to do in the last three games.  So, that's like 200 levels of the exact same thing.  It's all so easy with absolutely zero challenge, but for me, this is my last game of the series and when I'm done, I'll be done.  Good riddance.

4/10

Only recommended if you like easy 100%s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027424772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 2109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2109, 'last_played': 1558761492}
review:
[b][u]Game Information[/u][/b]

â€œ12 Labours of Hercules: Mother Natureâ€ Platinum Edition is a Strategy game. The game was developed by JetDogs Studios & Zoomout Games and published by JetDogs Studios.

â€œMother Natureâ€ is the fourth episode of â€œ12 Labours of Hercules.â€ Previous episodes: "12 Labours of Hercules;" "Cretan Bull" and "Girl Power."

Since this is a platinum edition, it comes with extra features that are not available in its counterpart; the standard edition.

[b][u]The Game Review[/u][/b]

Game Visuals

I want to mention that the visuals in the game are well done. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mention that audio for the game is well done. Even though the audio is somewhat simplistic and repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

This is a time management strategy game, where careful planning is required, due to the limited amount of resources that are available; hence the words "management" and "strategy."

The game has five episodes with ten levels each. Plus a bonus five bonus levels for each episode that can be unlocked by completing their jigsaw puzzle level.

There are three different difficulty game modes to choose from: Relaxed; Casual and Expert. The difference between these difficulty game modes is the scoring and timer speed. The relaxed mode has no scoring and timer. The casual mode lowing scoring and slow timer speed. The expert mode is high scoring and fast timer speed.

Three stars can be earned from playing the game on Casual and Expert mode. The stars that are earned depend upon how fast the level is completed and how much resources that are left in the resource storage bins.

The star ratings: Three stars (Gold) is when the game level is completed before the time passes the arrow on the timer. Two stars (Silver) is when the game level is completed as the time passes the arrow on the timer. One star (Bronze) is when the game level is completed as the time runs out on the timer.

There are several special power up bonuses in the game. These special power up bonuses help complete the level much quicker. These special power up bonuses have a time limit tied to them. But they recharged automatically over time. These special power up bonuses are useful when the game is being played on expert mode.

There are twenty-two different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that need to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Miscellaneous

There are nine different wallpapers. They can be accessed only through the game's main menu.

There are seven different trading cards to collect. Only three of those trading cards are given out by the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading card: Purchased from Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its' Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to a certain extent. The replay value for the game is low. I would recommend this game, but not at the game's full price value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181869895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1481007814}
review: Great game to kill time! I have never played the previous parts but I always tend to open this game when I want to kill time. It is a nice casual game and a great way to keep entertained. Worth the price and nice artwork 8/10 and would def. recommend it

author: {'steamid': '76561198083072026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1463111446}
review: Another enjoyable game in the 12 Labours of Hercules series! This one has quite a few challenging levels compared to previous installments, and adds a few new features. The special helpers get to do a bit more, and there's a new mechanic of trading food or wood for gold that works well. There's some cool map designs too, with portals added. You can't really go wrong with this if you like time management games or if you were a fan of previous games in the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1462044816}
review: Not sure why I like such a mindless click fest game.  There really isn't any strategy needed if you play the casual or standard difficulty levels to get gold, or three stars.  But, it's somewhat addicting and fun at the same time while being mindless.  Same as the rest of the series you are in charge of telling your workers and heroes what to do so you can finish each level.  Whether it's building things, or collecting resources, your workers and hereoes will be busy at every moment of every level.  Fun game if you don't mind the mindless gameplay.  However, if you play the expert level, which is required to play in order to beat the developer time achievements, then you will find that strategy does matter.  Do you want the extra worker first?  Do you want to upgrade your lumber mill first, should you get the gold mine first......all of these things make a huge difference in your time for beating a level and therefore gives you a better chance of obtaining gold.  Fun times and looking forward to 12 Labours of Hercules V.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112866114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1461676514}
review:
The fourth time management game in the long run series produced by http://jetdogs.com/ 

I must admit coming into this game I wasn't really expecting much as the previous 3 are pretty much the same thing. However this is by FAR is the best champagne corker and need of a toast that the developers can come up with new ideas if i have ever seen one. In fact if they finish the series off on this one I would understand as it would be difficult for them to top as they have really set the bar high for themselves now.

The biggest difference to me is that your time management actions and mangament of resources actually changes the backgrounds of each level as you create rivers and forests and beautify the surroundings. On the downside this doesn't last long as you will have to do it again each time you replay the level. Like in Hercules 3 though you do get to decorate a palace which stays that way for good.

There are many new characters, obtscales and decors that have not been in any of the previous versions. Some which at first created a 'what the hell' moment as I scratched my head how to defeat this new enemy. Also worthy to mention is that the level layout itself seems to be improved and some of them made me stop and think what i actually needed to do to get over there. I also like how they have changed the expert level so that it represents one big star and boy are they challenging. No longer is it about just the quickest way through the level but also what else can i click on in the level to raise my score up. Try and beat the developers record on 1.1 and you will soon see what i mean.

The fact that Hercules eventually travels to an alien God Like land and traverses the portals and landscape to subdue his enemy was also well done. The story seemed some what more interesting than previous versions and was slightly disappointed that we did not get to see more of him and 'yoshi' eating megara's fruit afterwards.

I would be seriously surprised if Jetdog trumps this version any more without ruining it, but just in case they are up for the challenge here are a couple of things that i would like to see them maybe implement...

1) More unusual achievements for us to try and get than the old ones you constantly rehash.
2) Instead of a palace which gets better and better, how about a garden like the 'hanging gardens of babylon'.
3) While your 12 desktops are welcoming thought they could have been better placed as an unlockable reward for those who go the extra mile to unlock all the achievements.
4) It would be nice if there was a super reward for those who are truly daring to beat the developers records on all the levels.
5) Maybe some other unlockable cards, music, facts or even a developers photo gallery at the end.

In final i guess this made the biggest impact on me only because i played the previous three and they didn't reach further than a mediocre experience. This one really showed that Jetdogs has the ability to think both out of the square, puch the boundaries and deliver. Thankyou.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047460864', 'num_games_owned': 3167, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1494681879}
review:
His name is Oliver Queen. For five years... Oh wait... Let's start over. His name is Hercules. For one year, he was bedridden, sick, his wife Megara at his bedside. That's what happens you piss some (not so) powerful gods off. In the meantime, for some reason, his land became barren and desert. So now he has to restore it, bring the animals and water back, while fighting a wicked version of himself summoned by the same (not so) powerful gods.

This fourth 12 Labours of Hercules brings every previous good ideas and mechanisms back ; still the same kind of game but with new stuff this time, unlike the previous opus. You'll discover some interesting things like a new portal system, hidden objects, more complex levels. There are even some new musics, including one very entertaining reminding me of Django (Tarantino).

In my opinion, this is the best game of the series. But if you have never played it, I suggest to start with the first game anyway. If you're looking for another kind of games, casual, relaxing yet entertaining, or if you liked the 12 Labours of Hercules' games so far, I will greatly recommend you to give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043973348', 'num_games_owned': 971, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1457448827}
review: This is the fourth installment of the "12 Labours of Hercules" series.  As someone who's played the previous three, I would say this is the strongest, as it incorporates all the elements from previous games, while adding some new mechanics. Here, Hercules and Megara have more of a role than in previous games, although the servants do most of the work (of course). What's interesting is how they've added other features , such as a "Midas Exchange", where you can exchange supplies or food for gold. There are new tracks to the original soundtrack as well. The gameplay is like the previous games, so if you haven't played them, I wouldn't recommend to start off with this one. Great for casual play to sneak in the day for a few minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971784544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1457310294}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1460053829}
review:
The creators of the 12 Labours of Hercules series are releasing the games faster than I can complete them :) Less than 1 year passed since the first game, and now I'm trying to finish the 4th and the 5th is already in sight. This rapid pace makes you suspicious that we have a "more of the same" situation here - and yes, while there are slight changes between the episodes, we basically have four near-identical games with almost 200 levels altogether. More of the same is not a sin, of course - if the quality remains stable and the pricing is right, it can be quite attractive. Fortunately, this is the case with 12LoH.

At this point, the game shouldn't need much introduction - if you're unfamiliar with the series, start with the first one, there's a demo and everyting. As a short summary, it's a time management game with appealing audiovisuals, good level design and a decent challenge on the hardest difficulty.

Compared to the first game, there are a few new elements, the most notable being Megara (Hercules' wife) playing an active part (starting from ep3, actually) - since she doesn't introduce strategic variety (ie. you're always best off doing all her tasks early), I don't find much value here. Thieves were also new in ep2 or ep3 (you can guess what they do), and in ep4, sometimes an evil version of Herules appears to scare your servants. Managing thieves does add an additional dimension to the gameplay, while evil H is just an annoyance.
The level design quality remains more or less constant. On most levels you need to make sure you balance your resources well, but there are some levels where you can find different solutions - these tend to be the more enjoyable.
Difficulty is an interesting question. I do feel that the games get easier as the series progresses, but it's quite possible that I'm so used to the gameplay that I automatically make better choices than in the first game. To counter this a bit, there's a developer record for each level beyond the gold time, but to be honest, I can't believe it's really what it's called - many times, I do better than that on the first try. So in the next installment, some extra difficulty would be nice.

All in all, it's easy to recommend the 12 Labours of Hercules series - buy one, play it through, if not bored yet, buy next, repeat. If bored, stop for a couple of months, and try again. When I think of the term "quality casual game", 12LoH is definitely one of the first game that springs to mind.
